description: ENHANCED semantic memory for PRODUCT_SUPPLIERS junction table - optimized for natural language semantic search

enhancements.common_questions: How users actually phrase their questions

chunks.text:
TABLE: product_suppliers

DESCRIPTION: Junction table linking products to suppliers with sourcing details including cost, lead time, and minimum order quantities.

NATURAL_LANGUAGE_TERMS: product suppliers, product supplier table, supplier products, product sourcing, sourcing table, supplier pricing, product vendor, vendor products, supplier cost, procurement data, sourcing information

PRIMARY_KEY: product_supplier_id

FOREIGN_KEYS: product_id → products.product_id, supplier_id → suppliers.supplier_id

TABLE_TYPE: Junction table with attributes (Many-to-Many relationship between products and suppliers)

USAGE: Product sourcing, supplier pricing lookup, lead time tracking, minimum order quantities, cost comparison, procurement planning, supplier alternatives

COMMON_QUERIES: Who supplies product, product cost from supplier, supplier lead times, cheapest supplier, product sourcing options, supplier alternatives

USE_CASES: Find suppliers for product, compare supplier costs, sourcing options, supplier lead times, procurement pricing

COLUMN: product_suppliers.product_supplier_id

DESCRIPTION: Unique identifier for each product-supplier relationship.

NATURAL_LANGUAGE_TERMS: product supplier id, product supplier ID, relationship id, sourcing id, record id, product supplier identifier, sourcing record id

DATA_TYPE: INTEGER

CONSTRAINTS: PRIMARY KEY, NOT NULL, AUTO-INCREMENT

USAGE: Relationship identification, sourcing record tracking, internal reference

USE_CASES: Internal tracking, relationship identification, sourcing record lookup

EXAMPLES:

- Specific record: SELECT * FROM product_suppliers WHERE product_supplier_id = 12001

BUSINESS_RULE: Unique identifier for each product-supplier combination. Immutable once assigned.

COMMON_QUESTIONS: Record ID? Relationship identifier?

COLUMN: product_suppliers.product_id

DESCRIPTION: Links to product being sourced.

NATURAL_LANGUAGE_TERMS: product id, product ID, which product, product identifier, product reference, item id, SKU, product being sourced

DATA_TYPE: INTEGER

CONSTRAINTS: FOREIGN KEY, NOT NULL

REFERENCES: products.product_id

USAGE: Product sourcing lookup, finding suppliers for product, product procurement, supplier options for product

USE_CASES: Who supplies product, suppliers for product, product sourcing options, find product suppliers

EXAMPLES:

- Product suppliers: SELECT * FROM product_suppliers WHERE product_id = 2050

- With supplier details: FROM product_suppliers ps JOIN suppliers s ON ps.supplier_id = s.supplier_id WHERE ps.product_id = 2050

- Supplier count: SELECT product_id, COUNT(DISTINCT supplier_id) AS supplier_count FROM product_suppliers GROUP BY product_id

BUSINESS_RULE: Multiple suppliers per product allowed. Join with suppliers to get supplier details.

COMMON_QUESTIONS: Who supplies product? Suppliers for product? Product sourcing options? Which suppliers?

COLUMN: product_suppliers.supplier_id

DESCRIPTION: Links to supplier providing the product.

NATURAL_LANGUAGE_TERMS: supplier id, supplier ID, which supplier, supplier identifier, vendor id, supplier reference, who supplies, supplier providing

DATA_TYPE: INTEGER

CONSTRAINTS: FOREIGN KEY, NOT NULL

REFERENCES: suppliers.supplier_id

USAGE: Supplier product catalog, what supplier provides, supplier sourcing, products from supplier

USE_CASES: Products from supplier, supplier catalog, what supplier provides, supplier product list

EXAMPLES:

- Supplier products: SELECT * FROM product_suppliers WHERE supplier_id = 11001

- With product details: FROM product_suppliers ps JOIN products p ON ps.product_id = p.product_id WHERE ps.supplier_id = 11001

- Product count: SELECT supplier_id, COUNT(DISTINCT product_id) AS product_count FROM product_suppliers GROUP BY supplier_id

BUSINESS_RULE: Multiple products per supplier allowed. Join with products to get product details.

COMMON_QUESTIONS: Products from supplier? Supplier catalog? What does supplier provide? Supplier products?

COLUMN: product_suppliers.cost_price

DESCRIPTION: Cost to purchase product from this supplier (wholesale price).

NATURAL_LANGUAGE_TERMS: cost price, wholesale price, supplier cost, supplier price, purchase price, cost from supplier, how much from supplier, supplier pricing, wholesale cost, procurement cost, vendor price

DATA_TYPE: DECIMAL(10,2)

CONSTRAINTS: cost_price > 0

USAGE: Cost comparison, supplier pricing analysis, procurement budgeting, margin calculation, cheapest supplier identification

USE_CASES: Compare supplier costs, cheapest supplier, supplier pricing, cost analysis, find best price, procurement budgeting

EXAMPLES:

- Product costs: SELECT s.supplier_name, ps.cost_price FROM product_suppliers ps JOIN suppliers s ON ps.supplier_id = s.supplier_id WHERE ps.product_id = 2050 ORDER BY ps.cost_price

- Cheapest supplier: SELECT s.supplier_name, ps.cost_price FROM product_suppliers ps JOIN suppliers s ON ps.supplier_id = s.supplier_id WHERE ps.product_id = 2050 ORDER BY ps.cost_price LIMIT 1

- Cost comparison: SELECT p.product_name, s.supplier_name, ps.cost_price, p.price AS retail_price, (p.price - ps.cost_price) AS margin FROM product_suppliers ps JOIN products p ON ps.product_id = p.product_id JOIN suppliers s ON ps.supplier_id = s.supplier_id

- Average cost: SELECT product_id, AVG(cost_price) AS avg_cost, MIN(cost_price) AS min_cost, MAX(cost_price) AS max_cost FROM product_suppliers GROUP BY product_id

BUSINESS_RULE: Wholesale/purchase cost from supplier. Compare with product retail price for margin. Find lowest cost for best sourcing.

COMMON_QUESTIONS: Supplier cost? How much from supplier? Cheapest supplier? Compare supplier prices? Supplier pricing? Best price?

COLUMN: product_suppliers.lead_time_days

DESCRIPTION: Number of days for supplier to deliver product after order.

NATURAL_LANGUAGE_TERMS: lead time, lead time days, delivery time, how long, days to deliver, supplier lead time, delivery days, time to deliver, shipping time, turnaround time, fulfillment time

DATA_TYPE: INTEGER

CONSTRAINTS: lead_time_days > 0

USAGE: Lead time comparison, fastest supplier identification, delivery planning, procurement timeline, reorder planning

USE_CASES: Fastest supplier, delivery time comparison, how long to deliver, quickest supplier, lead time analysis, delivery planning

EXAMPLES:

- Lead times: SELECT s.supplier_name, ps.lead_time_days FROM product_suppliers ps JOIN suppliers s ON ps.supplier_id = s.supplier_id WHERE ps.product_id = 2050 ORDER BY ps.lead_time_days

- Fastest supplier: SELECT s.supplier_name, ps.lead_time_days FROM product_suppliers ps JOIN suppliers s ON ps.supplier_id = s.supplier_id WHERE ps.product_id = 2050 ORDER BY ps.lead_time_days LIMIT 1

- Average lead time: SELECT product_id, AVG(lead_time_days) AS avg_lead_time, MIN(lead_time_days) AS fastest, MAX(lead_time_days) AS slowest FROM product_suppliers GROUP BY product_id

- Quick suppliers: SELECT s.supplier_name, COUNT(*) AS products FROM product_suppliers ps JOIN suppliers s ON ps.supplier_id = s.supplier_id WHERE ps.lead_time_days <= 7 GROUP BY s.supplier_name

BUSINESS_RULE: Days from order placement to delivery. Lower is better. Critical for inventory planning and reorder timing.

COMMON_QUESTIONS: How long to deliver? Fastest supplier? Delivery time? Lead time? Quickest supplier? Turnaround time?

COLUMN: product_suppliers.minimum_order_quantity

DESCRIPTION: Minimum quantity required per order from this supplier.

NATURAL_LANGUAGE_TERMS: minimum order quantity, MOQ, minimum order, min quantity, minimum purchase, order minimum, how many minimum, least amount, minimum buy, bulk requirement, order requirement

DATA_TYPE: INTEGER

CONSTRAINTS: minimum_order_quantity > 0

USAGE: Order quantity planning, supplier selection, procurement constraints, bulk buying requirements, order feasibility

USE_CASES: Minimum order requirements, MOQ comparison, order planning, supplier constraints, bulk requirements, feasible suppliers

EXAMPLES:

- MOQ by supplier: SELECT s.supplier_name, ps.minimum_order_quantity, ps.cost_price FROM product_suppliers ps JOIN suppliers s ON ps.supplier_id = s.supplier_id WHERE ps.product_id = 2050 ORDER BY ps.minimum_order_quantity

- Low MOQ suppliers: SELECT s.supplier_name, ps.minimum_order_quantity FROM product_suppliers ps JOIN suppliers s ON ps.supplier_id = s.supplier_id WHERE ps.product_id = 2050 AND ps.minimum_order_quantity <= 10

- MOQ cost impact: SELECT s.supplier_name, ps.minimum_order_quantity, ps.cost_price, (ps.minimum_order_quantity * ps.cost_price) AS minimum_spend FROM product_suppliers ps JOIN suppliers s ON ps.supplier_id = s.supplier_id WHERE ps.product_id = 2050

- Flexible suppliers: SELECT s.supplier_name, AVG(ps.minimum_order_quantity) AS avg_moq FROM product_suppliers ps JOIN suppliers s ON ps.supplier_id = s.supplier_id GROUP BY s.supplier_name ORDER BY avg_moq

BUSINESS_RULE: Minimum units required per order. Lower MOQ = more flexibility. Consider with cost for total minimum spend.

COMMON_QUESTIONS: Minimum order quantity? MOQ? Minimum order? How many minimum? Order requirements? Minimum purchase?

RELATIONSHIP: product_suppliers as junction table (Many-to-Many)

DESCRIPTION: Junction table connecting products and suppliers in many-to-many relationship with sourcing attributes.

NATURAL_LANGUAGE_TERMS: products and suppliers, product supplier relationship, who supplies what, supplier product mapping, sourcing relationships, product vendor connections

JOIN_CONDITION: products.product_id = product_suppliers.product_id AND product_suppliers.supplier_id = suppliers.supplier_id

CARDINALITY: M:N (many products have many suppliers, many suppliers provide many products)

TABLE_TYPE: Junction table with attributes (cost_price, lead_time_days, minimum_order_quantity)

USAGE: Product sourcing options, supplier alternatives, cost comparison, lead time analysis, procurement planning

USE_CASES: Find suppliers for product, products from supplier, compare sourcing options, supplier alternatives, procurement choices

EXAMPLES:

- Product sourcing options: SELECT p.product_name, s.supplier_name, ps.cost_price, ps.lead_time_days, ps.minimum_order_quantity FROM products p JOIN product_suppliers ps ON p.product_id = ps.product_id JOIN suppliers s ON ps.supplier_id = s.supplier_id WHERE p.product_id = 2050

- Supplier catalog: SELECT s.supplier_name, p.product_name, p.category, ps.cost_price FROM suppliers s JOIN product_suppliers ps ON s.supplier_id = ps.supplier_id JOIN products p ON ps.product_id = p.product_id WHERE s.supplier_id = 11001

- Complete sourcing matrix: SELECT p.product_name, s.supplier_name, ps.cost_price, ps.lead_time_days FROM products p JOIN product_suppliers ps ON p.product_id = ps.product_id JOIN suppliers s ON ps.supplier_id = s.supplier_id ORDER BY p.product_name, ps.cost_price

BUSINESS_RULE: Junction table enables many-to-many with sourcing attributes. One product can have multiple suppliers. One supplier can provide multiple products.

COMMON_QUESTIONS: Who supplies what? Product sourcing options? Supplier alternatives? Products and suppliers relationship?

RELATIONSHIP: product_suppliers to products (Many-to-One)

DESCRIPTION: Each sourcing record belongs to one product. Product can have multiple sourcing options.

NATURAL_LANGUAGE_TERMS: product sourcing, suppliers for product, product suppliers, who supplies product, sourcing options for product, product vendor options

JOIN_CONDITION: product_suppliers.product_id = products.product_id

CARDINALITY: N:1 (many sourcing records for one product)

FOREIGN_KEY: product_suppliers.product_id references products.product_id

USAGE: Finding suppliers for product, product sourcing options, supplier alternatives, cost comparison for product

USE_CASES: Who supplies product, product sourcing options, supplier alternatives for product, compare costs for product

EXAMPLES:

- Suppliers for product: SELECT p.product_name, s.supplier_name, ps.cost_price, ps.lead_time_days FROM products p JOIN product_suppliers ps ON p.product_id = ps.product_id JOIN suppliers s ON ps.supplier_id = s.supplier_id WHERE p.product_id = 2050 ORDER BY ps.cost_price

- Best sourcing option: SELECT p.product_name, s.supplier_name AS best_supplier, ps.cost_price, ps.lead_time_days FROM products p JOIN product_suppliers ps ON p.product_id = ps.product_id JOIN suppliers s ON ps.supplier_id = s.supplier_id WHERE p.product_id = 2050 ORDER BY (ps.cost_price * ps.lead_time_days) LIMIT 1

- Supplier count: SELECT p.product_name, COUNT(ps.supplier_id) AS supplier_count FROM products p LEFT JOIN product_suppliers ps ON p.product_id = ps.product_id GROUP BY p.product_name

BUSINESS_RULE: One product can have 0-many suppliers. Multiple sourcing options enable supplier alternatives and price competition.

COMMON_QUESTIONS: Who supplies product? Sourcing options? Supplier alternatives? Best supplier for product?

RELATIONSHIP: product_suppliers to suppliers (Many-to-One)

DESCRIPTION: Each sourcing record belongs to one supplier. Supplier can provide multiple products.

NATURAL_LANGUAGE_TERMS: supplier products, supplier catalog, what supplier provides, products from supplier, supplier offerings, supplier inventory

JOIN_CONDITION: product_suppliers.supplier_id = suppliers.supplier_id

CARDINALITY: N:1 (many sourcing records for one supplier)

FOREIGN_KEY: product_suppliers.supplier_id references suppliers.supplier_id

USAGE: Supplier product catalog, what supplier provides, supplier offerings, products available from supplier

USE_CASES: Supplier catalog, products from supplier, what supplier provides, supplier product list, supplier inventory

EXAMPLES:

- Supplier catalog: SELECT s.supplier_name, p.product_name, ps.cost_price, ps.lead_time_days FROM suppliers s JOIN product_suppliers ps ON s.supplier_id = ps.supplier_id JOIN products p ON ps.product_id = p.product_id WHERE s.supplier_id = 11001 ORDER BY p.product_name

- Supplier product count: SELECT s.supplier_name, COUNT(ps.product_id) AS products_supplied FROM suppliers s LEFT JOIN product_suppliers ps ON s.supplier_id = ps.supplier_id GROUP BY s.supplier_name ORDER BY products_supplied DESC

- Supplier by category: SELECT s.supplier_name, p.category, COUNT(*) AS product_count FROM suppliers s JOIN product_suppliers ps ON s.supplier_id = ps.supplier_id JOIN products p ON ps.product_id = p.product_id WHERE s.supplier_id = 11001 GROUP BY s.supplier_name, p.category

BUSINESS_RULE: One supplier can provide 0-many products. Multiple products per supplier enable consolidated ordering.

COMMON_QUESTIONS: Supplier catalog? Products from supplier? What does supplier provide? Supplier offerings?

QUERY USE CASE: Find all suppliers for a product with pricing

DESCRIPTION: List all available suppliers for a product with cost, lead time, and MOQ.

NATURAL_LANGUAGE_QUERIES: who supplies product, suppliers for product, product sourcing options, where to buy product, supplier alternatives, product suppliers

TABLES_USED: product_suppliers, products, suppliers

WHEN_TO_USE: Procurement planning, supplier selection, cost comparison, sourcing alternatives

SQL_PATTERN: SELECT suppliers FROM product_suppliers JOIN suppliers WHERE product_id = X

EXAMPLES:

- All suppliers: SELECT s.supplier_name, s.contact_name, ps.cost_price, ps.lead_time_days, ps.minimum_order_quantity FROM product_suppliers ps JOIN suppliers s ON ps.supplier_id = s.supplier_id WHERE ps.product_id = 2050 ORDER BY ps.cost_price

- Best option: SELECT s.supplier_name, ps.cost_price, ps.lead_time_days, (ps.cost_price * ps.minimum_order_quantity) AS min_spend FROM product_suppliers ps JOIN suppliers s ON ps.supplier_id = s.supplier_id WHERE ps.product_id = 2050 ORDER BY ps.cost_price, ps.lead_time_days

- With product info: SELECT p.product_name, s.supplier_name, ps.cost_price, p.price AS retail_price, (p.price - ps.cost_price) AS margin FROM products p JOIN product_suppliers ps ON p.product_id = ps.product_id JOIN suppliers s ON ps.supplier_id = s.supplier_id WHERE p.product_id = 2050

BUSINESS_RULE: Order by cost_price for cheapest option. Consider lead time and MOQ for complete evaluation.

COMMON_QUESTIONS: Who supplies product? Suppliers for product? Sourcing options? Where to buy? Supplier alternatives?

QUERY USE CASE: Find cheapest supplier for product

DESCRIPTION: Identify supplier with lowest cost for procurement optimization.

NATURAL_LANGUAGE_QUERIES: cheapest supplier, lowest cost, best price, most affordable supplier, least expensive, cheapest option, best deal

TABLES_USED: product_suppliers, suppliers, products

WHEN_TO_USE: Cost optimization, budget procurement, price comparison, finding best deal

SQL_PATTERN: SELECT supplier, MIN(cost_price) FROM product_suppliers WHERE product_id = X

EXAMPLES:

- Cheapest supplier: SELECT s.supplier_name, ps.cost_price, ps.lead_time_days, ps.minimum_order_quantity FROM product_suppliers ps JOIN suppliers s ON ps.supplier_id = s.supplier_id WHERE ps.product_id = 2050 ORDER BY ps.cost_price LIMIT 1

- Cost comparison: SELECT s.supplier_name, ps.cost_price, RANK() OVER (ORDER BY ps.cost_price) AS price_rank FROM product_suppliers ps JOIN suppliers s ON ps.supplier_id = s.supplier_id WHERE ps.product_id = 2050

- Cost with total spend: SELECT s.supplier_name, ps.cost_price, ps.minimum_order_quantity, (ps.cost_price * ps.minimum_order_quantity) AS minimum_spend FROM product_suppliers ps JOIN suppliers s ON ps.supplier_id = s.supplier_id WHERE ps.product_id = 2050 ORDER BY ps.cost_price

- Cheapest by category: SELECT p.category, p.product_name, s.supplier_name, ps.cost_price FROM products p JOIN product_suppliers ps ON p.product_id = ps.product_id JOIN suppliers s ON ps.supplier_id = s.supplier_id WHERE ps.cost_price = (SELECT MIN(cost_price) FROM product_suppliers WHERE product_id = p.product_id)

BUSINESS_RULE: Lowest cost_price is cheapest. Consider MOQ for total minimum spend. Verify lead_time acceptable.

COMMON_QUESTIONS: Cheapest supplier? Lowest cost? Best price? Most affordable? Least expensive? Best deal?

QUERY USE CASE: Find fastest supplier for product

DESCRIPTION: Identify supplier with shortest lead time for urgent procurement.

NATURAL_LANGUAGE_QUERIES: fastest supplier, quickest delivery, shortest lead time, fastest delivery, quickest supplier, fastest option, quick turnaround

TABLES_USED: product_suppliers, suppliers

WHEN_TO_USE: Urgent procurement, fast delivery needs, lead time critical situations, quick restocking

SQL_PATTERN: SELECT supplier, MIN(lead_time_days) FROM product_suppliers WHERE product_id = X

EXAMPLES:

- Fastest supplier: SELECT s.supplier_name, ps.lead_time_days, ps.cost_price, ps.minimum_order_quantity FROM product_suppliers ps JOIN suppliers s ON ps.supplier_id = s.supplier_id WHERE ps.product_id = 2050 ORDER BY ps.lead_time_days LIMIT 1

- Lead time comparison: SELECT s.supplier_name, ps.lead_time_days, ps.cost_price, RANK() OVER (ORDER BY ps.lead_time_days) AS speed_rank FROM product_suppliers ps JOIN suppliers s ON ps.supplier_id = s.supplier_id WHERE ps.product_id = 2050

- Fast and affordable: SELECT s.supplier_name, ps.lead_time_days, ps.cost_price FROM product_suppliers ps JOIN suppliers s ON ps.supplier_id = s.supplier_id WHERE ps.product_id = 2050 ORDER BY (ps.lead_time_days * 0.5 + ps.cost_price * 0.5) LIMIT 5

- Quick suppliers: SELECT s.supplier_name, COUNT(*) AS quick_products FROM product_suppliers ps JOIN suppliers s ON ps.supplier_id = s.supplier_id WHERE ps.lead_time_days <= 7 GROUP BY s.supplier_name ORDER BY quick_products DESC

BUSINESS_RULE: Lowest lead_time_days is fastest. Balance with cost_price for best value. Verify MOQ feasible.

COMMON_QUESTIONS: Fastest supplier? Quickest delivery? Shortest lead time? Fastest option? Quick turnaround?

QUERY USE CASE: View all products from specific supplier

DESCRIPTION: List complete product catalog available from a supplier.

NATURAL_LANGUAGE_QUERIES: supplier products, supplier catalog, what does supplier provide, products from supplier, supplier offerings, supplier inventory

TABLES_USED: product_suppliers, suppliers, products

WHEN_TO_USE: Supplier evaluation, consolidated ordering, catalog review, supplier capabilities assessment

SQL_PATTERN: SELECT products FROM product_suppliers JOIN products WHERE supplier_id = X

EXAMPLES:

- Supplier catalog: SELECT p.product_name, p.category, ps.cost_price, ps.lead_time_days, ps.minimum_order_quantity FROM product_suppliers ps JOIN products p ON ps.product_id = p.product_id WHERE ps.supplier_id = 11001 ORDER BY p.category, p.product_name

- Catalog with margins: SELECT p.product_name, ps.cost_price, p.price AS retail_price, (p.price - ps.cost_price) AS margin, ROUND(100.0 * (p.price - ps.cost_price) / p.price, 2) AS margin_pct FROM product_suppliers ps JOIN products p ON ps.product_id = p.product_id WHERE ps.supplier_id = 11001

- By category: SELECT p.category, COUNT(*) AS product_count, AVG(ps.cost_price) AS avg_cost FROM product_suppliers ps JOIN products p ON ps.product_id = p.product_id WHERE ps.supplier_id = 11001 GROUP BY p.category

- Supplier summary: SELECT s.supplier_name, COUNT(ps.product_id) AS products, AVG(ps.cost_price) AS avg_cost, AVG(ps.lead_time_days) AS avg_lead_time FROM suppliers s JOIN product_suppliers ps ON s.supplier_id = ps.supplier_id WHERE s.supplier_id = 11001 GROUP BY s.supplier_name

BUSINESS_RULE: Group by category for organized view. Include cost and lead time for procurement planning.

COMMON_QUESTIONS: Supplier products? Supplier catalog? What does supplier provide? Products from supplier? Supplier offerings?
